item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Books are the mirrors of the soul." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Blame it or praise it, there is no denying the wild horse in us." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "She had the perpetual sense, as she watched the taxi cabs, of being out, out, far out to sea and alone; she always had the feeling that it was very, very, dangerous to live even one day." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "It is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes makes its way to the surface." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Literature is strewn with the wreckage of those who have minded beyond reason the opinion of others." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "They went in and out of each other's minds without any effort." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "It is far harder to kill a phantom than a reality." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I see you everywhere, in the stars, in the river, to me you're everything that exists; the reality of everything." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Let us again pretend that life is a solid substance, shaped like a globe, which we turn about in our fingers. Let us pretend that we can make out a plain and logical story, so that when one matter is despatched—love for instance—we go on, in an orderly manner, to the next. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "That perhaps is your task--to find the relation between things that seem incompatible yet have a mysterious affinity, to absorb every experience that comes your way fearlessly and saturate it completely so that your poem is a whole, not a fragment; to re-think human life into poetry and so give us tragedy again and comedy by means of characters not spun out at length in the novelist's way, but condensed and synthesized in the poet's way--that is what we look to you to do now." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "What does the brain matter compared with the heart?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Mrs Dalloway is always giving parties to cover the silence" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "It is no use trying to sum people up." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "To let oneself be carried on passively is unthinkable." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "To look life in the face, always, to look life in the face, and to know it for what it is...at last, to love it for what it is, and then, to put it away..." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "It might be possible that the world itself is without meaning." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ron Currie Jr.
item.description: "Here's to loving for that long, too, and loving perfectly, without error or sorrow, held forever on the edge of madness by our desire, but never tumbling over. Salud." -- Ron Currie Jr.

item.title: Sarah add a quote by James Salter
item.description: "Women fall in love when they get to know you. Men are just the opposite. When they finally know you they're ready to leave" -- James Salter

item.title: Sarah add a quote by James Salter
item.description: "Sometimes you are aware when your great moments are happening, and sometimes they rise from the past. Perhaps it's the same with people." -- James Salter

item.title: Sarah add a quote by James Salter
item.description: "The book was in her lap; she had read no further. The power to change one’s life comes from a paragraph, a lone remark. The lines that penetrate us are slender, like the flukes that live in river water and enter the bodies of swimmers. She was excited, filled with strength. The polished sentences had arrived, it seemed, like so many other things, at just the right time. How can we imagine what our lives should be without the illumination of the lives of others?" -- James Salter

item.title: Sarah add a quote by James Salter
item.description: "Of them all, it was the true love. Of them all, it was the best. That other sumptuous love which made one drunk, which one longed for, envied, believed in, that was not life. It was what life was seeking; it was a suspension of life. But to be close to a child, for whom one spent everything, whose life was protected and nourished by one's own, to have that child beside one, at peace, was the real, the deepest, the only joy." -- James Salter

item.title: Sarah add a quote by James Salter
item.description:
"They lay silently. She was staring at something across the room. She was making him feel uncomfortable. 'It wouldn't work. It's the attraction of opposites,' he said.
We're not opposites.'
I don't mean just you and me. Women fall in love when they get to know you. Men are just the opposite. When they finally know you they're ready to leave." -- James Salter
